instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915-B No PPVCORE
threads.message:
I have an 820-2915-B that came in not powering on with a battery so swollen that the cells cracked the battery casing and a not functional DC-in board. Customer mentioned he had left the computer without every touching it for about 6 months because he was having issues with it powering on with chime but never any video on the screen. After replacing both battery and dc-in board, computer only powers on about 1 out of every 4 attempts and it only does this when both battery and magsafe are plugged in (light only turns green and never orange). When it does power on, I get no image on the screen and no chime, and the fans start spinning after a few moments then stop after a couple seconds and never start again. Even rarer, I do hear a chime but still no video, although usually I get the above described scenario.

With board out, I sometimes get green light and sometimes not when magsafe is plugged in, regardless I never get any fan spin. I also am getting 12.52V on PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS whenever magsafe Is plugged in (with or without green light) but I never get VCORE_S0_CPU at any phase and the CPU does not ever feel like it is getting warm.

Board looks free of any obvious corrosion or physical damage, any suggestions on where to look next? Thanks in advance

threads.title: 820-2915-B No PPVCORE
threads.message: Probably a dead GPU as usual. These machines are truly hopeless.

threads.title: 820-2915-B No PPVCORE
threads.message: I was afraid of that but it makes sense. Is there a way for me to check for this, or should i just let it go?

threads.title: 820-2915-B No PPVCORE
threads.message: Heat it up and see if it works again, but it is all a waste of time on these things.
